And what \"stupid answer\" is that, Rajiv? I`m sure you have plenty of them, you need to be more specific.rnrnI have a Masters in English & I\'m pretty sure I have a pretty good idea as to how to talk to others and a far wider vocabulary than you`ll ever have.rnrnAs a `pirate`who never shares or uploads anything, and one that also spams others torrents with negativity, what gives you the right to question the quality of my torrents? Either download or not, it`s your choice. No-one else seems to mind the quality, just you.rnrnNow, about that \"stupid answer\"? I\'d love to hear it!

First, many thanks to dougaldog2002 for a very well crafted technical upload. However, the size of the rip and the nature of the film quality from the 1970s makes this a rather granulated looking visual. I'm afraid that a 1.4 gig container and the ratio selected just make for a bad video quality here.

Format                           : MPEG-4 Visual
Format settings, BVOP            : 1
Format settings, QPel            : No
Format settings, GMC             : No warppoints
Format settings, Matrix          : Default (H.263)
Muxing mode                      : Packed bitstream
Codec ID                         : DX50
Codec ID/Hint                    : DivX 5
Duration                         : 2h 55mn
Bit rate                         : 426 Kbps
Width                            : 480 pixels
Height                           : 208 pixels
Display aspect ratio             : 2.35:1
Frame rate                       : 23.976 fps
Color space                      : YUV
Chroma subsampling               : 4:2:0
Bit depth                        : 8 bits
Scan type                        : Progressive
Compression mode                 : Lossy
Bits/(Pixel*Frame)               : 0.178
Stream size                      : 536 MiB (38%)
Writing library                  : DivX 6.8.5 (UTC 2009-08-20)

It's a fine offer, and when so many people are still constrained by bandwidth and so forth, it deserves to stay well seeded. There is also a Blu-ray rip available, but at over 10 gig, that is too large for many. I am going to try a fresh rip on my copy of the DVD, and see if I can offer a companion torrent to this one at higher visual quality.

To be clear, I am NOT griping! This is a great torrent, but the video (in this age of LCDs and Hi Res) is just too painful to watch for long. I encourage the OP to keep ripping films, but to use higher ratios for such long ones.
